DOC.detailed_description: To evaluate comparative efficacy Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy ( TF-CBT ) v Child Centered Therapy ( CCT ) decrease symptoms Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder ( PTSD ) follow recent sexual abuse . Child sexual abuse common experience serious mental health consequence , include development PTSD abuse-related general psychopathological symptom . Patients randomly assign receive either TF-CBT CCT two site , provide 12 week individual therapy child parent . Treatment monitor compliance respective treatment model intensive supervision , audiotaping session , rating session use adherence checklist , independent blind rating audiotape . Treatment outcome evaluate use several self- , parent- , teacher-report standardized instrument , administer pre- post-treatment , follow-up evaluation 6 12 month . The project also assess differential treatment impact gender ethnicity , attempt evaluate impact specific component treatment process mediate treatment outcome . Specifically , project evaluate differential effectiveness two treatment modality improve subject 's abuse-related attribution perception , parent practice , familial adaptability cohesiveness , parent support , parental emotional reaction abuse , impact improve variable treatment outcome .
